body:
I don't think there's an issue with the example. The intention was do demonstrate a geo dataframe with `lat` and `lon` columns. What in the text led you to think that each column must contain one of those substrings?

> Nice catch! Weird that we hadn't caught that yet in our builds...

This is a code-block, not an ipython block.

> I don't think there's an issue with the example. The intention was do demonstrate a geo dataframe with `lat` and `lon` columns. What in the text led you to think that each column must contain one of those substrings?
> 
> > Nice catch! Weird that we hadn't caught that yet in our builds...
> 
> This is a code-block, not an ipython block.

The code would not work previously (see Details at the end of my post) you are right though I misinterpreted the intent and I would like to change my commit to:

```
       @staticmethod
       def _validate(obj):
           # verify there is a column latitude and a column longitude
           if 'latitude' not in obj.columns or 'longitude' not in obj.columns:
               raise AttributeError("Must have 'latitude' and 'longitude'.")
```
Do I push a new commit into my branch? I don't know how to modify an existing commit.

Thank you
